results.title: ‘The Many Saints of Newark’ Review: The Best Really Is Over
results.abstract: In the movie prequel to “The Sopranos,” Tony returns as a child who learns to navigate his families on a difficult road to mob power.

results.title: Ladies and Gentlemen, Daniel Craig
results.abstract: At long last, the star of the James Bond franchise bids farewell to 007 with “No Time to Die” (and learns for the first time about his life as an internet meme).

multimedia.caption: “Maybe I’ll be remembered as the Grumpy Bond,” Daniel Craig said. But, he added, “I’m quite satisfied with that.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: The Academy Museum Finds Good Intentions in Messy Film History
results.abstract: While the cinematic objects on display fascinate, the much-delayed institution opens with an emphasis on diversity and pluralism, not past and present sins.

results.title: ‘Titane’ Review: Auto Erotic
results.abstract: Julia Ducournau’s new film, a prizewinner at Cannes, is a grisly, philosophical thriller that puts the pedal to the metal.

results.title: ‘Britney vs Spears’ Review: When the Intervention Is the Problem
results.abstract: A Netflix documentary directed by Erin Lee Carr offers a timely if vexing primer on the pop star’s legal battle, which may finally be coming to an end.

results.title: Their Film Is One of the Weirdest Prizewinners of the Year. Deal With It.
results.abstract: “Titane” may follow a female killer who has sex with a car and impersonates a man’s son, but the director and star say it’s really about love.

results.title: Karen Dalton, a Musical Mystery That Doesn’t Need to Be Solved
results.abstract: A new documentary about the blues-folk singer, who died in 1993, works to make her known without unraveling all of her riddles.
des_facet: Karen Dalton: In My Own Time (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Karen Dalton recorded just two albums, suffered drug and alcohol addictions and succumbed to an AIDS-related illness at age 55. But her story is more than simply a tragedy.
Karen Dalton recorded just two albums, suffered drug and alcohol addictions and succumbed to an AIDS-related illness at age 55. But her story is more than simply a tragedy.

results.title: Mesdames et messieurs, Daniel Craig
results.abstract: Avec “Mourir peut attendre”, l’acteur tire sa révérence et dit adieu à 007. Après 15 ans passés à incarner un “Bond Bougon”, il prépare le rôle de Macbeth à Broadway.

multimedia.caption: “Peut-être qu’on se souviendra de moi comme du Bond Bougon,” dit Daniel Craig. Mais il précise: “ça me convient tout à fait.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin pour The New York Times

results.title: The Married Couple Behind the Dreamy Feminist Action Film ‘Mayday’
results.abstract: The writer and director Karen Cinorre and the cinematographer Sam Levy met in a college film class over 20 years ago. More recently, they collaborated on Cinorre’s first feature.

results.title: Ruth Sullivan, Advocate for People With Autism, Dies at 97
results.abstract: After her son was found to be autistic, she started organizations to help children and adults. She also consulted on the making of the movie “Rain Man.”

multimedia.caption: Ruth Sullivan, center, with her husband and seven children in an undated photo. Her son Joe, seated to her left, was diagnosed with autism in the early 1960s.

results.title: For Al Franken, a Comeback Attempt Goes Through Comedy Clubs
results.abstract: Onstage, the ex-senator and “S.N.L.” star doesn’t exactly address his fall from grace. But he doesn’t not address it either. Asked if he’ll run again, he is noncommittal.

results.title: Done With Bond, Daniel Craig Will Play Macbeth on Broadway

results.title: A Specialist in Short and Lethal Movie Thrillers Jumps to TV
results.abstract: The French director Julien Leclercq’s action movies are known for their ruthless economy. His new Netflix thriller, “Ganglands,” tests his approach across six episodes.

multimedia.caption: “I think all filmmakers today have fantasies of tackling a series,” said Julien Leclercq, “I’ve watched ‘True Detective’ five times, ‘Breaking Bad’ three times.”
